description: Serial entrepreneur, investor, writer best-known as the founder of Buddy Media, a social marketing software company that was purchased by Salesforce.com (NYSE: CRM) for $800M.

name: David Golan
title: Founder & CTO
description:
David is the co-founder, board director, and former CTO of Viz.ai, a digital healthcare company harnessing deep learning to analyze medical data and improve clinical workflow. Viz.ai developed the first ever FDA-approved AI-powered automatic triage system for stroke and is commercially installed in more than 800 hospitals across the US and Europe.
Prior to founding Viz.ai, David was a Fulbright postdoctoral scholar at Stanford University, working on leveraging deep learning for the analysis of medical imaging and genetic data. David holds a Ph.D. in Statistics and Machine learning from TAU and has co-authored more than 20 scientific papers including three publications in the journal Science. Prior to his academic career, David founded the ML team of b-hive Networks, an Israeli startup that was acquired by VMWare in 2008.

name: David Millstone
title: CEO
description:
David J. Millstone is co-Chief Executive Officer of Standard Industries, a privately-held, global industrial business.
With over 20,000 employees and operations in more than 80 countries, Standard Industries’ businesses span a broad array of holdings, technologies and investments—including both public and private companies from early to late-stage—as well as world-class building solutions, performance materials, real estate, logistics and next-generation solar technology. Its operating companies include GAF, BMI, Grace, GAF Energy, Siplast, SGI, Schiedel and Standard Logistics, as well as Standard Investments and Winter Properties.
Mr. Millstone is a graduate of Yale College and Harvard Law School and currently serves on the University Council at Yale and the Board of Advisors of the Harvard Law School Program on Corporate Governance. With his wife, Jennifer, he is active in supporting a number of civic organizations, including the Partnership for Public Service, the 92nd Street Y, the Fortune Society and the Bard Prison Initiative.

name: Daniel Sundheim
title: Founder & CIO
description: Daniel Sundheim is the Founder and Chief Investment Officer of D1 Capital Partners. D1 is a global investment firm that operates across public and private markets. The firm combines the talent and operational excellence of a large, premier asset management firm with the flexible mandate and long-term time horizon of a family office. Founded in 2018, D1 focuses on investing in the global internet, technology, telecom, media, consumer, healthcare, financial, industrial, and real estate sectors. Prior to forming D1, Dan spent 15 years at Viking Global Investors where he most recently served as the CIO responsible for managing a team of analysts and a diversified portfolio.

name: Dan Senor
title: Chief Public Affairs Officer
description:
Dan Senor is an Equity Partner, the Chief Public Affairs Officer, and a member of the Management Committee at Elliott Investment Management L.P. He joined Elliott in 2010, and has since developed and supervises the firm’s global communications team, global public policy team, and geopolitical risk functions. Mr. Senor has served as a senior advisor to U.S. Senator Mitt Romney and former U.S. Speaker of the House Paul Ryan in their campaigns for national office. 
Mr. Senor co-authored The New York Times bestseller _Start-Up Nation: The Story of Israel’s Economic Miracle_ (2009). He currently serves as a trustee of The Paul E. Singer Foundation, Start-Up Nation Central, and the Abraham Joshua Heschel School. Mr. Senor holds a B.A. in History from the University of Western Ontario and studied in the one-year international program at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. He received his M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.

name: Ariel Szklanny
title: Founder & CTO
description: Oshi CTO Ariel Szklanny obtained his Ph.D. in Tissue Engineering at Shulamit Levenberg's lab at the Technion, in which he specialized in 3D printing cells and biomaterials to create vascularized tissues. During his Ph.D., Ariel authored or co-authored nine papers, many of those published in high-impact journals. Previously, Ariel obtained his Biomedical Engineering degree at the National University of Entre Ríos in Argentina, in which he wrote his thesis on designing a polymeric droplets generator device for the medical industry.

name: Avi Simon
title: Founder & CTO
description: Previously Chief Data Officer of the Israel Defense Forces, overseeing the IDF’s R&D in the areas of software, data, and artificial intelligence. Also served as the CIO and CTO of the Israeli intelligence corps and commanded numerous R&D units. Experienced R&D manager in the fields of artificial intelligence, data science, computer vision, software development, and information technology. Hold an MSc and BSc in Systems and Electrical engineering, both from the Technion. Passionate about people, organizations, and digital transformation via disruptive technologies.

name: Aviram Shmueli
title: Founder & Chief Research & Innovation Officer
description:
I'm an 8200 and Israeli Ministry of Defense alumni with 20+ years of hands-on and senior managerial experience in engineering and product management organizations, driving innovation and execution in the cyber security and cloud computing domains.

I'm now working on Jit, an exciting venture I have founded with my 4 amazing partners. Jit's mission is to help developers adopt MVS (minimal viable security) and own security from day zero. Security should no longer be an afterthought or a tax for developers and their teams. It should be built into their products correctly and right from the start, improving by that the business velocity. Every high-velocity progressive developer organization will benefit from Jit.

name: Asi Shefer
title: Founder & CSO
description: My life quest is to understand the interaction between reality and the mind. In my journey, I've developed novel approaches that mimic human cognitive systems in linguistics, generalization, and multi-domain learning. My years in the academy and industry working with enterprises like IBM and LogMeIn, as well as startups, fueled One AI’s vision - to build human-inspired AI for everyone.

name: Aviv Dror
title: Founder & CPO
description: One AI CPO Aviv Dror is an experienced startup leader and product Leader. Prior to co-founding One AI Aviv co-founded Nanorep which was acquired by LogMeIn.

name: Brett Rochkind
title: Investor
description: Brett Rochkind is a Managing Partner at Softbank Vision Fund II. Previously he founded and ran BRK Capital, a global technology investing platform based in Silicon Valley. Prior to founding BRK, Brett was a Managing Director at General Atlantic (GA), a global growth investment firm that manages more than $35 billion in capital, where he led GA’s Silicon Valley office and was the Global Co-Head of the Technology sector. Brett was at GA for 15 years beginning in New York in 2002 investing in Software, Services and Internet businesses and helped GA expand its investment operations into Brazil and Latin America. In 2009, Brett moved to Hong Kong to help expand GA’s China presence and explore opportunities across China, India and Asia. In 2017, Brett left GA to build a growth fund with Charles River Ventures (CRV), a 50 year old venture firm best known for early investments in Twitter, Zendesk, Yammer, DoorDash, Pillpack and Airtable.

name: Aviv Ben-Yosef
title: CTO Coach
description: Aviv Ben-Yosef is a consultant who helps tech executives lead and create highly-performant autonomous teams. With a background in software technology and experience working with dozens of companies globally, he helps tech leaders achieve the 10x engineering dream by putting in place a culture that enables engineers and managers to become engineering force-multipliers. He is on a mission to make our industry work smarter, not harder. When he’s not consulting, he’s likely working on his book, playing with his three kids, or picking up a new hobby.

name: Dan Sarel
title: Founder & VP Product
description: Dan is the Chief Product Officer and co-founder at Descope. Dan’s career spans over 2 decades where he started as a Sales Engineer in a network security company and continued to hold various senior PM positions in companies such as Check Point, Sentrigo and McAfee. Prior to Descope, Dan was VP Product at Palo Alto Networks after the acquisition of Demisto, where he was co-founder and VP Product.

name: Meitav Harpaz
title: Founder & CEO
description:
I build companies that rely on data engineering to solve complex business challenges in financial services. I strive to build companies and teams that challenge the norms, are highly collaborative, and have an insane motivation to succeed even when the odds are stacked against them. 

I managed product releases across the entire software lifecycle - from concept to sales. I also learned first-hand how to build from the ground up every function in a new organization, by bootstrapping a 100+ people strong business with highly effective marketing, sales, operations, financing and HR functions amongst others. 

I am very particular about quality, experience and value and try to combine them all in a unique company and product to bring to market.

name: Meir Wahnon
title: Founder & Director of Engineering
description:
Meir is a co-founder at Descope, a drag-and-drop customer authentication and identity management platform. Before Descope, Meir served as Sr.Director of Engineering at Palo Alto Networks after the acquisition of Demisto, where he was part of the founding team. Meir is passionate about open source, no code/low code platforms and ML.

In his spare time, Meir likes to try out new Michelin star restaurants around the world.

name: Max Blankfeld
title: Founder and COO
description: Originally from Brazil, started and managed several companies in the area of consumer products in Brazil and the USA. Founded GoCollege.com in 1997 with a successful exit in 2001. Founded Gene by Gene - FamilyTreeDNA.com in 2000, the first direct-to-consumer genetic testing company, with an exit in January 2021.

name: Maor Farid
title: Founder & CEO
description: Leo AI CEO Maor Farid is a mechanical engineer with expertise in Applied Mathematics and Artificial Intelligence. Maor did his postdoc in applied math and AI in the Mechanical Engineering Dept of MIT, where he was a Fulbright fellow. He received his Ph.D. at the age of 24 from the Technion and attended Harvard's executive program. Named to Forbes' 30 Under 30 list, Maor served as a mechanical engineer, AI researcher, data scientist, and commander at the Israeli Prime Minister's Office and Unit 8200 - the Israeli Intelligence Corps. Maor is also the founder of the award-winning NGO Learn to Succeed, a winner of the Moskowitz Prize for Zionism for social activity and contribution to the integration of students and youth at risk from the Israeli socioeconomic and geographic periphery.

name: Liad Meidar
title: Founder & Managing Partner
description: Liad Meidar is Founder and Managing Partner of Gatemore Capital Management LLP, an independent asset manager founded in 2005 and based in London, managing an activist strategy focused on turnarounds, recoveries and dislocated growth opportunities. Liad serves on the board of directors of three Gatemore portfolio companies: GSE Worldwide, Inc, a sports marketing agency where he is Chairman, Lionano SE, Inc., a solid-state battery developer, and SurvivorNet, Inc., an online health media company.  He also serves on the Board of Trustees of the American School in London.  Liad received an AB in economics from Princeton University.

name: Leonid Belkind
title: Founder & CTO
description: Torq founder and CTO Leonid Belkind previously co-founded and was CTO of Luminate Security, a pioneer in Zero Trust Network Access and Secure Access Services Edge. At Luminate, Leonid guided this enterprise-grade service from inception, to Fortune 500 adoption to acquisition by Symantec. Before Luminate, Leonid managed engineering organizations at CheckPoint Software Technologies that delivered enterprise firewalls and other network, endpoint and data security products.

name: Jonathan Seelig
title: Founder
description: Co-founder and CEO of Ridge. Co-founder of Akamai. Longtime investor and advisor to startups.

name: Marcio Lempert
title: Venture Partner
description:
Marcio Lempert, has over 25 years of experience in hi-tech companies, in top management positions, in Israel and US. As an executive Marcio led Finjan Software Security (acquired by M86 Security and Trustwave).

As a BOD advisor and mentor, during the last 3 years, led to 3 exits: Solebit Labs (acquired by Mimecast), Preempt Security (acquired by CrowdStrike) and  Polyrize (acquired by Varonis).

During the last few years, Marcio has been involved in social businesses (CEO of the Dualis fund), volunteering projects, BOD director for non-for-profit organisations and teaches entrepreneurship in the IDC academic institution in Israel.

Marcio is now involved in setting up GITA. An NGO driven to promote impact-tech investments and businesses.

name: Jonathan Miller
title: Founder & Chairman
description: Jonathan Miller is a seasoned technology leader with over 30 years of experience. He is best known for his role as CEO of AOL, where he oversaw the company's transformation into a major online media and advertising platform. He also held senior positions at Amazon and Time Warner, and co-founded the venture capital firm Ignition Partners. Miller is a graduate of Harvard Business School and Stanford University, and serves on the boards of several public and private companies. He is a highly respected figure in the technology community, known for his intelligence, strategic vision, and ability to execute on complex initiatives.

name: Jonathan Levav
title: Professor
description: Professor of Marketing at Stanford Graduate School of Business. Two-time winner of dean's award for teaching excellence. Research expertise in consumer behavior and psychology of decision-making. Frequent corporate speaking and consulting on marketing, decision making, and innovation. Startup advisor (CocoTerra, NotCo, FounderNest, Beehive.ai, NeoMed, Azos Insurance, Medcase, Plantish). Co-founder at Honeystone Ventures.

name: Kyle Quest
title: Founder & CTO
description:
Kyle (aka Q) is a cloud-native citizen who's been building cloud-based platforms and products since the early days of cloud computing. 

Prior to founding Slim.AI, Kyle worked on many interesting challenges related to distributed systems, Big Data, and security at companies like Cisco, CrowdStrike, and Microsoft.

Kyle is also the creator of DockerSlim, a tool to optimize and simplify the developer experience with containers.

name: Uzair Dada
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Uzair Dada is the Founder and CEO of Iron Horse and at Event (Event Lead Management SaaS solution). Over the last 20 years, Uzair has built Iron Horse from a startup to an award-winning growth marketing agency helping global brands build scalable integrated marketing programs. His areas of expertise include building and executing B2B and Developer Marketing programs focused on emerging technology areas like AI, Big Data, IoT, game development and developer tools.

Prior to founding Iron Horse, he held senior positions at Intraware, Deloitte, Apple, Kidder, Peabody and Citi. He is a member of the Board of Axos Bank and the Kellogg Advisory Council.

Uzair is a graduate of Haas School of Business at UC Berkeley and Kellogg School of Business at Northwestern University.

name: Tal Cohen
title: Senior Engineering Director
description: Tal leads the engineering teams for multiple verticals in Google Search. Managing teams in Israel, India, Korea, and the US, Tal has co-led the revolution of providing direct answers to users' needs through Search, starting in 2010, including many features that power Google Assistant answers. Prior to that, was a frontend engineer in Google's ads team, completed a PhD in software engineering at the Technion, and gained his first managerial experience in a startup in the mid-90s.

name: Yochai Levi
title: Founder & CMO
description: Yochai, co-founder and CMO of One AI, previously led marketing at WeWork, Conduit, and Kasamba (acq. by LPSN). He is also an angel investor and advisor in companies and NGOs including NanoRep (acq. by LOGM), Feedvisor, Anodot, nununu, Natural Intelligence, Dendro Neurotech, Healthy.io, and the Computational Neuropsychiatry Lab.

name: Yair Geva
title: Partner
description: Yair heads the Tech Group at Herzog, Israel's top and largest law firm. Prior to joining Herzog, he practiced in New York at Davis Polk and Gibson Dunn - two of the most prestigious law firms in the US. At Herzog he led a talented team of the US/UK/Israeli qualifier lawyers working on cutting-edge innovative projects: venture capital, mergers and acquisitions, and complex licensing transactions for top emerging companies and prominent cross-border strategic and financial investors. He is also an active angel investor in numerous Israeli tech companies and an investment advisor to a leading global venture capital fund.

name: Tzahi Weisfeld
title: GM
description:
Tzahi (Zack) Weisfeld is a seasoned executive and a serial entrepreneur, with 25+ years of experience in tech consumer and enterprise markets. General manager and head of Ignite: Intel for Startups program. President of ASN (Accelerating Startup Nations), Zack was one of the founders of Microsoft Israel R&D site as well as a member of its management team for 8 years. Zack was also Head of Microsoft for Startups and Founder of the Microsoft Accelerators, his responsibilities span across 110 countries and included Microsoft BizSpark, Global startup accelerator partnership with 200+ accelerators in 47 countries, Microsoft Later Stage Accelerators in Seattle, Bangalore, Beijing, Shanghai, Berlin, London and Tel Aviv, as well as post acceleration programs and VC engagement.

Prior to Microsoft for Startups, Zack co-founded a few startups, including Sequoia-backed Mintigo (Acquired by Anaplan), Vice President of Marketing & Strategy at modu, the Israeli personal communications startup. (IP sold to Google Corp.) Before that, Zack held the position of Sr. Director of Business Management at Microsoft Corp. Prior to his period at Microsoft, Zack was the General Manager Americas and Corporate Vice President for the Mobile Market at msystems (NSDQ: FLSH), which was acquired by SanDisk Corp (NSDQ: SNDK) for 1.6B at the end of 2006. According to Business Insider (May 2014) - Zack Weisfeld is among the 10 top Most Influential Israelis In Tech Worldwide. Zack was also named one of the top influencers on Israeli Tech by NewsGeek magazine (Dec. 2015).

name: Yoram Yaacovi
title: Venture Partner
description:
Microsoft: For seven years and through January 2018, Yoram was the General Manager of the Microsoft Israel Research & Development center, one of the three Microsoft Global Development Centers (GDCs), responsible for the R&D centers in Herzlia, Haifa and Nazareth, developing core cybersecurity, business intelligence and big data analytics products for Microsoft. During his tenure as General Manager, Microsoft Israel shipped multiple products globally, acquired seven companies in Israel and co-founded the Microsoft Startup Accelerator, one of the first successful corporate accelerators globally.

Earlier in his career Yoram served in a variety of software development at Microsoft in Redmond. He is the co-author of 23 patent applications and several IETF RFCs.



Today: These days Yoram is splitting his time between being a Venture Partner at the at the West Fountain Global Fund, the global fund of Shenzhen Capital Group, the largest VC in China, serving as an advisor to several Israeli startups in cybersecurity, digital advertising and enterprise software.



Ecosystem: In 2017, Yoram was appointed to the Board of Directors of the Technion, Israel’s Institute of Technology, where he also serves on the Advisory Board of the Computer Science department.

name: Saul Greenberger
title: Founder & President
description: Founder of PharmScript in 2008 after recognizing the opportunity to improve the pharmacy service for long-term and post-acute care facilities. As a former nursing home administrator in New York City, I have experienced firsthand the challenges and opportunities of creating a seamless pharmacy experience. Empowered by this experience, I set to create a company dedicated to supporting its clients in their goal of providing the best possible care to residents and patients. Responsible for expanding new relationships and supporting current clients in implementing best practices, quality control, and fiscal accountability in the pharmacy arena. Trusted thought leader, frequently speaking at industry conferences and regularly sharing insights in respected publications.

name: Stav Aldaag
title: Founder & CPO
description: Stav Aldaag is a product executive and advisor with over 10 years of experience building and leading product organizations. She has successfully launched multiple SaaS products, impacting hundreds of customers and millions of users.

name: Sarit Firon
title: Partner
description: Sarit Firon is Managing Partner of Team8 Capital, the new investment vehicle of the Team8 group. One of Israel’s most accomplished investors known for helping to build companies and bring them to IPO and acquisitions, Sarit brings more than 26 years of global investment and operational experience across Silicon Valley, New York, and Tel Aviv. She has held numerous operational and leadership roles, serving as CEO, CFO, Chairperson, and board member at prominent high-tech companies. She served as CFO at MediaMind during its Nasdaq IPO and acquisition by DG Corp for $517M, as well as at P-Cube during its $200M acquisition by Cisco. She also led the seed round of Datorama, taking an active board member role until the company’s$800M acquisition by Salesforce. Prior to joining Team8 Capital, Sarit was Managing Partner of Cerca Partners, which invested in tech companies in the Israeli ecosystem and was part to some of the most notable acquisitions and IPOs including Armis (acquired by Insight Partners for $1.1B), Alooma (acquired by Google), Demisto (acquired by Palo Alto Networks for $560), Dynamic Yield (acquired by McDonalds for $300M) and Fiverr (NYSE: FVRR). Sarit’s experience gives her both exceptional insight and instincts about the viability of a startup, as well as the proven ability to be an active partner in its development and growth. Sarit sits on the board of Shitufim, a social impact non-profit organization.

name: Roy Erez
title: Founder & CEO
description: With experience in investing in dozens of startups and co-founding two ventures, Roy now serves as the Founding Partner of R-Squared Ventures, a venture fund guided by a 'founders supporting founders' ethos. Before this role, Roy was the Co-Founder and CEO at Loop Commerce, a company disrupting fintech, retail, and commerce. He started Loop in 2012, raised $30 million from tier-1 industry leaders, scaled it through the acquisition by Synchrony in mid-2018, and continued to run the company as a wholly owned subsidiary as CEO and as a GM and SVP with Synchrony until departing in mid-2020. Roy is passionate about innovation - building and growing great products and businesses. He continues to be engaged in entrepreneurship as an active investor through R-Squared Ventures, a co-founder and board Member, and as an LP and advisor in select funds and companies. He earned his MBA from Columbia Business School and lives in Silicon Valley, California.

name: Ronen Faier
title: CFO
description: Ronen Faier holds the position of Chief Financial Officer for SolarEdge Technologies, Inc, a leader in the field of solar and renewable energy. He is also on the board of S.M.R.E. SpA. Previoulsy he held the position of Chief Financial Officer for msystems Ltd., Chief Financial Officer for Modu Ltd., Chief Financial Officer for e-Glue Software Technologies, Inc., Chief Financial Officer at Western Digital Israel Ltd. and Controller for magicJack VocalTec Ltd. Mr. Faier received an undergraduate degree from The Hebrew University of Jerusalem and an MBA from Tel-Aviv University.

name: Ron Sicsic
title: Founder & CSO
description: Ron is the Chief Scientific Officer at Oshi, with a background in Organic Chemistry, Veterinary Medicine, Molecular Biology and Genomics. Formerly a practicing veterinarian, and Co-Founder & Head of R&D at Enviro Advanced Energy, a bio-fuel company.

name: Steve McLaughlin
title: Founding Partner
description: Steve is a FinTech Banker, Entrepreneur, and Investor. Specialties: All sectors of Financial Technology (FinTech): Banking, P2P/Alt Lending, Payments, Mobile, Loyalty, Securities/Wealth Mgmt & Capital Markets, Healthcare IT, Insurance/InsurTech, Benefits, Fin Srvcs BPO, Financial Management Solutions (FMS), Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC), SaaS, Blockchain / Crypto and more. Focused on helping the leading companies / CEOs across the broad financial technology / fintech ecosystem raise private equity and debt capital, execute initial public offerings (IPOs) and conduct M&A transactions.

name: Robert Cohen
title: Founding Partner
description: Investor and entrepreneur active globally, focused on B2C, Digital SMB and Passionware - all things revolving around the “passion economy”. Managing Partner of all Benson Oak investment funds since 2003, including Benson Oak Ventures, our latest fund focused on Israeli technologies.

name: Richard Forman
title: Partner
description:
Currently the managing partner of Health Venture Group, LLC a private investment company focused on technology and consumer related health care investments. Co-founder of Sapphire Digital (formerly Vitals.Com), 

Mr. Forman is a board member for Maimonides Medical Center (“MMC”), the leading treatment facility and academic medical center in Brooklyn, NY. MMC has approximately $1.2 billion in revenue.

Previously, Mr. Forman was co-Founder, President and CEO of Register.com, Inc. (NASDAQ-RCOM) through June of 2003. During his tenure, Mr. Forman led the Company through explosive growth and change including

Mr. Forman is a Cum Laude graduate of the University of Pennsylvania's Management and Technology Program where he earned a B.S. in Economics from the Wharton School and a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from the Moore School. He also obtained a Masters Degree from New York University's Real Estate Institute. Currently, he sits on the Board of Overseers for the School of Engineering at Penn and is Chair of the Penn Engineering Online Learning Committee.

name: Raluca Ragab
title: Venture Partner
description:
Growth equity investor partnering with extraordinary founders in Israel and Europe. Special areas of interest: vertical & horizontal software, cloud infrastructure, data infrastructure, vertical AI. Focused on helping businesses scale up thru $50-100mmARR and beyond to IPO. Led growth stage rounds and served on the Board of Israeli champions that went on to IPO in the US: MBLY, GLBE, WKME. 

I also roll my sleeves alongside founders to prepare for and manage life as a listed equity business post IPO including by being a NED or identifying appropriate ones, identifying and training IR professionals, developing a sharp equity story to differentiate, managing expectations in the quarters post listing, developing a modus operandi of the co of interfacing with public investors, etc.

name: Ran Mokady
title: SVP Real Time Operations, Head of European R&D

name: Paul Grinberg
title: Chairman
description: Paul is a senior strategic and financial leader with strong experience in mergers & acquisitions, raising capital in both the public and private markets and working with the investment and financial communities. Accomplished in financial and strategic planning, managing global operations and driving operational performance and improvements. Extensive background with high-growth situations, Wall Street and venture/private equity backed companies. Proven ability to solve complex business and financial problems. Strong technical, analytical and team building skills combined with creativity, common sense and good judgment.

name: Rishi Bhargava
title: Founder & CBO
description:
Rishi Bhargava is a co-founder at Descope, a developer-first authentication and user management platform. In a career spanning over 20 years, Rishi has run product, strategy, go-to-market, and engineering for category-creating cybersecurity startups and large enterprises. Before Descope, Rishi served as VP of Product Strategy at Palo Alto Networks which he joined via the acquisition of Demisto. Rishi was a co-founder at Demisto where, under his stewardship, the company created and later led a new “security orchestration” category within 3 years before being acquired. Prior to Demisto, Rishi was VP and GM of the Datacenter Group at Intel Security and launched multiple products at McAfee (acquired by Intel).

Rishi is passionate about technology and serves as an active investor and advisor to multiple startups in Silicon Valley and India, some of which have already seen successful exits.

name: Ramon Snir
title: Founder & CTO
description: Ramon Snir has a decade of experience in software engineering, product management, and software architecture. Prior to founding inScreen, Ramon worked at Dynamic Yield for 7 years in various roles including Director of Product & Program Management heading the Quick Service Restaurants group, and at Stackbit as a Senior Software Engineer.

name: Rakesh K. Loonkar
title: Founder & President
description: Rakesh is a cybersecurity entrepreneur and a seasoned executive. As president, Rakesh is responsible for sales, business development, and go-to-market strategy. In 2007, Rakesh founded Trusteer, which was acquired by IBM in 2013. Previously, Rakesh was the founder of OneSecure (acquired by NetScreen Technologies) and then served as vice president of North American sales at NetScreen (now part of Juniper Networks). Rakesh has made early investments in successful cybersecurity companies including Palo Alto Networks (PANW), Securent (now part of Cisco), Mi5 Networks (now part of Symantec), Watchdox (now part of Blackberry), and many others.

name: Or Shoval
title: Founder & CEO
description: Or Shoval is the Co-Founder & CEO of Remepy. Or served as a captain in an elite unit in the Israeli Defense Forces for over six years, overseeing both special field operations as well as new technological development initiatives. In his last position, Or led interdisciplinary teams of elite combat fighters and product developers from technological units. Or holds a bachelor's degree in Liberal Arts and Philosophy from the Shalem College Honors Program in Jerusalem.

name: Ori Keren
title: Founder & CEO
description: As an ex-VP of Engineering at Cloudlock ($293M exit to Cisco), I discovered there’s no better feeling as an engineering leader than enabling your team to be happy with their work and deliver efficiently with the highest quality. That’s why I co-founded LinearB and serve as its CEO. We want to give organizations the ability to work like this all the time.

name: Nuseir Yassin
title: Founder & CEO
description:
I grew up as a Palestinian-Israeli. Hated it. Went to Harvard. Graduated. Got a job. Hated it. Started making videos. Loved it.

Currently, I am building Nas Company. Nas means People in Arabic, and our singular focus is to "Bring People Together". We have raised over $23m in funding so far to achieve this mission. Nas.io provides technology tools for Creators to help them build communities, monetize their knowledge, and grow on the Internet. 

We're also lucky to have Nas Daily, which has grown to over 65+ million followers across all social media in 14 languages. Content is an essential piece in building communities.

name: Ofek Ron
title: Founder & CEO
description: Oshi CEO Ofek Ron was previously the founding board member and VP of Business Development at Vegan-Friendly, an international non-profit organization that aims to end animal suffering and by changing meat consumption towards plant-based food. Prior to Vegan-Friendly, Ofek was the CEO of Software-Sources, one of the largest software distribution houses in Israel. Ofek holds a bachelor's degree in Business & Economics from Reichman's University.

name: Niv Efron
title: Senior Director of Engineering
description:
Niv has been one of the founding members of the Google Israel R&D office. 
He has built and led large cross-functional teams that created and owned core Google Search and Ads products including Google Trends, Search Console and Pinpoint. Currently he leads research on large scale AI models, focusing on Climate & Health. Niv also mentors startups via the Google Campus program.
Before Google Niv had specialized in building large scale systems for the defense and aerospace worlds. He has a M.SC in Computer Science from Tel-Aviv University, focused in machine learning and bioinformatics.

name: Mo Koyfman
title: Founder & Managing Partner
description: Mo Koyfman has served as the Founder and Managing Partner of Shine Capital since September 2020. Additionally, Mr. Koyfman has served as a Managing Member of MOKO Brands since January 2017. Mr. Koyfman served as General Partner of Spark Capital from September 2008 to May 2016, and as Chief Operating Officer of Connected Ventures, a subsidiary of IAC, from August 2007 to March 2008. Mr. Koyfman previously held various M&A and business development positions at IAC from February 2002 to August 2007 and led the acquisition of Connected Ventures in December 2006. Prior to joining IAC, Mr. Koyfman served as an investment banker at Bear Stearns from July 2000 to February 2002. Mr. Koyfman has served as a founding board member of Sefaria since January 2013, and also serves on the Future Leadership Council of the Whitney Museum of American Art. He has previously served on the board of directors of ArtWorks, and as a member of the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum Collections Counsel and the New York Public Library Tech Advisory Group.

name: Moti Moravia
title: Founder & CTO
description: Leo AI co-founder & CTO Moti Moravia is both an AI expert and a seasoned Mechanical and System Engineer. With a proven record in the startup industry as Head Architect of AI systems and Data Science Team Leader, and in the Israeli Ministry of Defense as Captain, leading the development of AI algorithms and Mechanical systems for Israel's main battle Tank and infantry fighting vehicles. A co-author of an innovative course on AI in chaotic systems at the Technion. Moti earned his MSc and BSc degrees, Summa Cum Laude, in just four years from Technion's Faculty of Mechanical Engineering. He completed his studies as part of the IDF Intelligence Corps' elite program "Brakim" and has been honored with both the Technion's Award for Academic Excellence and the Brakim program award for Outstanding Academic Achievements.

name: Mila Khrapchenko
title: Founder & CEO
description:
Mila Khrapchenko, co-founder and co-CEO of Ameetee, is a seasoned professional in structured finance and complex solutions for corporate and retail clients of banks. She has successfully built and led a structured finance business at one of the leading privately owned banks in Emerging markets. Additionally, Mila, along with co-founder Sergey Shlyuger, established a venture business line at BCS Financial Group.

With a passion for venture capital, Mila has made over 30 personal investments in early-stage VC projects globally. She actively contributes to fundraising, networking, and strategic advice for these ventures. She is a member of such angel investor communities as AngelsDeck Global Ventures and New Economic Investors Club.

name: Jesse Hertzberg
title: Growth Partner
description: Jesse Hertzberg is an experienced entrepreneur and executive passionate about building world-class organizations and dedicated to scaling high-growth technology businesses. Jesse has a proven record of driving profitable growth at a variety of high-growth technology companies – such as Etsy, Squarespace, Livestream, and BigSoccer – by instilling an entrepreneurial culture, valuing measurable performance, profitably acquiring customers, and prioritizing customer-centric product development. Jesse is a growth partner with Great Hill Partners, and is an active angel investor, CEO coach, and startup advisor.

name: Neil Ackerman
title: Head of WorldWide Innovation
description:
Neil leads Worldwide (EMEA, APAC, Americas) Supply Chain Innovation and Growth Disruption for Kenvue, previously known as the Johnson and Johnson Consumer Health Company. Prior to this role, as an Expat in Tel Aviv, he led the development and scaling of the global Innovation Hubs for Johnson and Johnson across Pharmaceuticals, Medical Devices and Consumer Products. In these leadership positions, Neil leads and builds an experienced global team while creating the holistic eco-system focused on collaborative partnerships (VC, Start-ups, Universities, Grants) in support of broad innovation.

Prior to these roles Neil spent years at Amazon and holds 8 patents on fulfillment and logistics. Lastly, Neil has many years of experience with start-ups including as an Advisor and Board member.

name: Jeff Bussgang
title: Partner
description: Jeff is Co-Founder and General Partner of Flybridge Capital Partners, a seed stage venture capital firm based in NYC and Boston with over $700 million under management across five funds and four pre-seed funds. Jeff is also a senior lecturer at Harvard Business School where he serves on the entrepreneurship faculty teaching a popular MBA course, Launching Tech Ventures.

name: Hesky Kutscher
title: Founder & CEO
description:
As the CEO & Co-Founder of Aktivate, I am passionate about revolutionizing the scholastic sports management landscape. With a focus on digital transformation, our platform empowers athletic departments and schools to streamline their programs, benefiting student athletes and their families.

Drawing upon my extensive experience as an entrepreneur, I have successfully navigated the realms of VC fundraising and bootstrapping. Prior to Aktivate, I played a significant role in the success of CareDox, where we transformed from a B2C company into the nation's leading digital health platform for K-12 public schools. This experience has provided me with invaluable insights and a deep understanding of the intersection between technology, healthcare, and education.

At Aktivate, I am dedicated to driving growth, overseeing business development efforts, and building high-performing organizations. Through strategic partnerships and innovative solutions, we are reshaping how schools manage their athletic programs and empowering student athletes to take control of their athletic journey.

With a specialization in sales and a proven track record in organizational development, I am committed to creating an impactful and sustainable future for Aktivate. Let's connect and explore how we can leverage technology to transform the scholastic sports industry and unlock the full potential of student athletes.

name: Itamar Falcon
title: Founder & CEO
description: I started my journey in the IDF’s 8200 unit. Following the army I studied CS at the Technion. After my studies, I worked as a product manager as part of the APM programs at Google and Microsoft.

name: Hila Elimelech
title: Founder
description: Hila is a co-founder and former director of R&D at Oshi. She holds a Ph. D in Materials Chemistry from the Hebrew University and has a decade of experience with Additive Manufacturing (aka 3D printing). Prior to Plantish, Hila served as the focal point for 3D printing in the Israeli Ministry of Defense, where she led the utilization of this technology for the development of novel platforms. Prior to that, she was involved with the foundation of Nano-Dimension, which deals with additive manufacturing of electronics, where she served as VP of materials. Hila has vast experience with executing multi-disciplinary R&D initiatives and executing a concept to realism.

name: Guy Rinat
title: Founder & COO
description: Guy is a co-founder at Descope. Before Descope, Guy served as VP of Engineering at Palo Alto Networks after the acquisition of Demisto, where he was a co-founder. Prior to Demisto, Guy was VP of R&D at Sentrigo, a database security startup that was acquired by McAfee, where Guy then served as VP of Engineering. Guy’s career spans over two decades and is marked by creating products that customers love, building teams, and nurturing budding security and software leaders.

name: Giovanni Canetta
title: Managing Partner
description: Giovanni is CEO and Chief Investment Officer of Planven Investments. Previously he was the Senior Advisor and General Manager in charge of restructuring M&C, a listed investment company controlled by Planven Investments. Giovanni has many years of experience leading industrial companies in transition and in investment banking for Merrill Lynch,Crédit Agricole and UBS Investment Banking.

name: Gilad Shriki
title: Founder & VP Customer Success
description: Gilad is a co-founder at Descope and has been working closely with customers for over 20 years across engineering, product management, and services. Before Descope, Gilad served as VP of Customer Success for the Cortex product line at Palo Alto Networks, where he joined via the acquisition of Demisto. Gilad joined Demisto early on and built the services, customer success, and customer support offerings and organizations from the ground up. Before Demisto, Gilad worked on the database technologies product team for McAfee and spent time in the telecommunications domain before the iPhone was a thing. When he’s not helping customers, Shriki enjoys skiing, building home automation components, and spending time with his family.

name: Erez Dagan
title: EVP Product & Strategy
description: Erez Dagan was responsible for Mobileye’s business objectives, the company’s product planning and architecture, strategic planning and initiatives, and advanced development projects. He also led forward communication with Mobileye’s OEM customers. In his 18-year Mobileye career, Dagan led teams responsible for computer vision algorithms, object detection technologies, and advanced driver assistance system (ADAS) products, such as adaptive cruise control and automatic emergency braking. Dagan also serves as a board member for Mobileye’s Japan subsidiary. Dagan received a bachelor’s degree in computer science from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem and an MBA from IDC, Herzliya. Off duty, Dagan enjoys several hobbies, including painting, photography, hiking, skydiving and music jamming.

name: Eran Gorev
title: President Israel
description: Eran is President Israel and Senior Operating Partner at Francisco Partners. Prior to joining FP Eran was the President and CEO of Alvarion. Previously, he held a number of executive leadership positions at NICE Systems, a leading provider of solutions that capture and analyze interactions and transactions, realize intent, and extract and leverage insights. At NICE, as Chief Business Officer and President and CEO of NICE Systems Inc., Eran led the transformation of the company from its original HW-orientation to a provider of software-based business and analytics solutions, more than doubling the global business and the bottom line. Prior to NICE Systems, Eran held a number of senior leadership roles at Amdocs, a global telecom software provider, where he oversaw global sales, and ran a division addressing the needs of some of North America’s major telecommunications carriers. Earlier in his career, Eran’s experience spanned a number of sales leadership roles at Digital Equipment Corporation, as well as software engineering and program management.

name: Eran Etam
title: Founder
description: Eran was a co-founder and the VP R&D of ICQ, the world's first Instant Messenger, which was acquired by AOL for $407M in 1998. After holding a VP position in AOL, Eran served as an R&D advisor at the MoD technology division. Eran started several other Internet startups before co-founding Kaltura on September of 2006. Eran holds a BSc in Mathematics and Computer Science from Tel Aviv University

name: Eldad Livni
title: Founder & CPO
description: Eldad Livni is an experienced R&D, product, business, and corporate development executive. He currently leads StackPulse product development. Prior to co-founding StackPulse, Eldad co-founded Luminate Security (acquired by Symantec) and, prior to that, worked more than a decade for Check Point Software Technologies, where he was responsible for developing enterprise-grade products.

name: Elad Shoushan
title: Founder & CPO
description:
4x entrepreneur; product executive at Fortune 100; passionate about tackling massive problems with digital products and technology. Founded, led, and scaled startup companies. Invested in, advised, and coached amazing Founders/CEOs. Incepted over 40 products in cyber security, medical devices, education, quick commerce, fulfillment, and fintech. I was fortunate to build 28 mobile apps that achieved the top 5 position in Education as well as Food & Beverages categories at Apple’s AppStore and Google PlayStore worldwide. My apps have been used by 20M+ consumers, generated tens of millions of dollars, and have been featured over 2,000 times as the best apps in their respective categories. 
Aside from that, I love spending time with my three amazing kids. And as a fun fact - a long time ago I played basketball professionally in Israel.

name: Fei Dingan
title: Founder
description:
Founder Joffre Capital a mid-market tech buyout fund. Venture Partner of Softbank Ventures Asia. 
Previous led Warburg Pincus technology practice in China and South East Asia. Served on boards of Grindr, Gojek, NIO, Uxin. Other investments include Kuaishou, Trax, Liepin.

name: Efi Cohen
title: Founder & CTO
description: Efi Cohen is Head of Salesforce Israel R&D Centre and SVP, Product and Engineering at Datorama, a Salesforce company, and most recently, was Co-Founder and CTO of Datorama which was acquired by Salesforce in 2018. Efi has been building and managing industry-leading products and teams for the past 21 years. Prior to founding Datorama in 2012, Efi was part of the founding team (employee number one) of Eyeblaster (MediaMind / Sizmek) where he led and built the architecture and technology as VP Technology. MediaMind went public (NASDAQ) in 2010 and got acquired by DG Inc in 2011.

name: Dror Feldheim
title: Founder & President
description: Dror Feldheim is a co-founder and the Chief Commercial Officer (CCO) at Trax. Dror is responsible for Trax’s global sales management, distribution channel management, marketing communications, pricing and customer service. Before being named CCO in Jan 2015, Dror was Trax’s VP of Global Sales and Business Development, where he oversaw negotiations, joint ventures and partnerships that complement Trax’s long-term vision and strategy. Prior to joining Trax, Dror has had over 15 years of business development experience within the FMCG sector. With proven track record of successfully launching FMCG brands in diverse geographies, he has managed various categories for tier-one manufacturers and distributors across both emerging and developed markets. Dror has a strong background in customer success and category leadership, constantly seeking innovative ways to meet both customer and business needs.

name: David Politis
title: Founder & CEO
description: David Politis is the founder and CEO of BetterCloud, the first provider of SaaSOps solutions to manage and secure the digital workplace. With 300+ employees in Atlanta, New York City, and San Francisco, BetterCloud has raised $187 million to date from investors including Warburg Pincus, Bain Capital Ventures, Accel, Greycroft Partners, and Flybridge Capital Partners. David's entire career has been dedicated to improving the modern workplace through innovative, next-generation cloud (SaaS) technology. Previously he held executive positions at Cloud Sherpas (acq. by Accenture) and Vocalocity (acq. by Vonage). David is a long-time contributor to TechCrunch, Mashable, VentureBeat, and Forbes, where he writes about topics like enterprise cloud technology, cloud computing, and entrepreneurship.

name: Dennis Troper
title: Director of Product Management
description: Dennis is Director of Product Management at Wear OS by Google. Previously, he led product for Google Fiber and led product development for Google's social/local business products, including Google+ Pages and Google My Business. Prior to that, he was Product Director for Google Apps for Work, Group Product Manager for Google's internal CRM tools used globally by Google's ads salesforce and a Product Manager for AdWords.

name: Daniel Ramot
title: Founder & CEO
description: Daniel is the co-founder and CEO of mobility unicorn Via, and an advisor to the TechAviv Founder Partners fund.

name: David Melamed, PhD
title: Founder & CTO
description: Co-Founder & CTO of Jit, I have a Ph.D. in BioInformatics and a long-time experience building complex applications in the cloud. Worked previously at MyHeritage, CloudLock (acquired by Cisco), and Cisco in the CTO Office where I led strategic projects and technical innovation.
